title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed two goals, including one from center ice, in Team USA's win against Denmark.
Swayman humorously responded to a theory that black boards hindered his visibility by saying he's colorblind.
Team USA could opt for Connor Hellebuyck or Jake Oettinger as starting goalie in future Olympic games.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum is nearing a potential return from an Achilles injury, impacting the Celtics' playoff prospects.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony expressed high expectations for Tatum's performance upon his potential NBA return.
Celtics' Jaylen Brown leads the team towards playoffs as Tatum's return could enhance their postseason lineup.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space available for offseason signings.
Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker are potential targets for Patriots.
Bills C Connor McGovern and Ravens TE Isaiah Likely are also free agent options for New England.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN launches new streaming partnership with MLB.TV, making it MLB's streaming home for out-of-market games in 2026.
Subscribers to ESPN Unlimited can add MLB.TV for the season at $134.99, while non-subscribers pay $149.99 with a free ESPN month.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers will automatically renew, and ESPN Unlimited is not required to maintain their MLB.TV subscription.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a G League practice with the Maine Celtics, sparking speculation about his potential return.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement over Tatum's performance, noting he looked like his usual self.
Tatum is cautious about expectations, stating his participation aligns with rehab plans; no return date is confirmed.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. according to WalletHub's 2026 study.
The state leads in higher education attainment with over 47% holding a bachelor's degree and 22% a graduate degree.
Vermont and Maryland ranked second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia were last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare Honus Wagner T206 baseball card is being auctioned by Ken Goldin, closing February 21, 2026.
The card has Massachusetts ties, originally owned by Morton Bernstein who co-owned a Taunton silver plant.
The auction's current bid is $3.9 million, with a fee adjusting the total to approximately $4.76 million.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman, Bruins goalie, will start for Team USA against Denmark in his first Olympic appearance.
Swayman helped Team USA win the 2025 IIHF World Championship, boosting his stock for the Olympics.
Swayman's current season record is 22-12-3 with a 2.92 GAA and .903 save percentage.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A dead 3-year-old North Atlantic right whale was found off a Virginia barrier island, identified by New England Aquarium.
This marks the second right whale death in two weeks, following a 4-year-old male's death due to fishing gear entanglement.
The whale belonged to the critically endangered species, with only about 380 individuals, including 72 reproductive females, remaining.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts reports 260 flu-related deaths this season, including seven pediatric cases, per Department of Public Health data.
Flu activity strained hospitals in January, but case numbers are declining in February, though risks remain.
Officials urge flu vaccinations for children, older adults, and high-risk individuals to prevent severe illness.
